biography.value:
Legends speak of a dimension where flavors are sentient and dragons are their ultimate expression. The Condiment Drake is believed to be a rare, aberrant manifestation from this 'Flavorverse', somehow crossing into the material plane. Its presence often heralds strange culinary phenomena â€“ rivers flowing with gravy, trees bearing fruit that tastes of mustard, or skies raining pickles. It is a creature of instinct and bizarre appetite, seeking to impose its unique 'gastronomic order' on the world.

Behavior: The Condiment Drake is a chaotic and unpredictable creature, driven by its insatiable hunger and a bizarre instinct to 'flavor' its surroundings. It views combat as a culinary experiment, often opting for the most visually striking or potentially debilitating condiment for its breath attack. It may retreat if its 'ingredients' run low or if it encounters an overwhelming 'flavor' it cannot comprehend.

Appearance: Imagine a dragon, but instead of scales, its hide is a patchwork of glistening, burger-bun-like texture in varying shades of golden brown. Its wings are reminiscent of giant lettuce leaves, and its tail ends in a bulbous, ketchup-dispenser-like appendage. Its eyes are like wide, unblinking black olives, and its maw drips with various viscous sauces.

Twist: The Condiment Drake is not naturally malicious, but rather a cosmic entity that has somehow become fused with the concept of fast food. Its breath weapons are not inherently harmful but rather attempts to 'season' the world to its own peculiar, alien palate.

Habitat: Found in areas with strong culinary associations, such as bustling marketplaces, forgotten food stalls, or near planar rifts that have a peculiar 'flavor' about them.

Treasure: None

description.value: [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.
[[lookup @name lowercase]] exhales a blast of a specific condiment in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a saving throw or be affected by the condiment's effect.

automationWarnings: Condiment Breath (Recharge 5-6) [wgaljjxmvkoazofm]: Description implies saving throw but activity.save is missing.

description.value: As part of the Condiment Breath, the drake can choose to spray mustard. Each creature in the cone must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 4d6 acid damage and is blinded until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't blinded.

As part of the Condiment Breath, the drake can choose to spray ketchup. Each creature in the cone must make a DC 16 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 4d6 bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone.

As part of the Condiment Breath, the drake can choose to spray relish. Each creature in the cone must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 4d6 poison damage and is poisoned for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't poisoned.
Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using CHA as the spellcasting ability:

At Will: prestidigitation, acid splash, poison spray

3/Day Each: grease

2/Day Each: acid arrow, hold person

1/Day Each: cloudkill

This spell is a minor magical trick that novice spellcasters use for practice. You create one of the following magical effects within range:

  • You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.
  • You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.
  • You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.
  • You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.
  • You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.
  • You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand and that lasts until the end of your next turn.

If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

You hurl a bubble of acid. Choose one creature you can see within range, or choose two creatures you can see within range that are within 5 feet of each other. A target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or takeÂ 1d6acid damage.

This spell's damage increases byÂ 1d6Â when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

You extend your hand toward a creature you can see within range and project a puff of noxious gas from your palm. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 1d12 poison damage.

This spell's damage increases by 1d12 when you reach 5th level (2d12), 11th level (3d12), and 17th level (4d12).

Slick grease covers the ground in a 10-foot square centered on a point within range and turns it into difficult terrain for the duration.

When the grease appears, each creature standing in its area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. A creature that enters the area or ends its turn there must also succeed on aÂ Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.

materials.value: A bit of pork rind or butter

description.value:
You create a 20-foot-radius sphere of poisonous, yellow-green fog centered on a point you choose within range. The fog spreads around corners. It lasts for the duration or until strong wind disperses the fog, ending the spell. Its area is heavily obscured.

When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a Constitution saving throw. The creature takes 5d8 poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures are affected even if they hold their breath or don't need to breathe.

The fog moves 10 feet away from you at the start of each of your turns, rolling along the surface of the ground. The vapors, being heavier than air, sink to the lowest level of the land, even pouring down openings.

Higher Levels.Â When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 5th.

A shimmering green arrow streaks toward a target within range and bursts in a spray of acid. Make a ranged spell Attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 4d4 acid damage immediately and 2d4 acid damage at the end of its next turn. On a miss, the arrow splashes the target with acid for half as much of the initial damage and no damage at the end of its next turn.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage (both initial and later) increases by 1d4 for each slot level above 2nd.

materials.value: powdered rhubarb leaf and an adder's stomach

description.value:
Choose a humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be &Reference[paralyzed] for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

Higher Levels.Â When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional humanoid for each slot level above 2nd. The humanoids must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

materials.value: A small, straight piece of iron

effects.name: Hold Person
effects.description: The target is Paralyzed for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.
